newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft forms top executive committee.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft forms top executive committee.

text.p: Microsoft Corp. said Tuesday it has formed an executive committee to replace its Office of the President as its top decision-making group.

Senior vice presidents Jim Allchin and Brad Silverberg are joining the new executive committee, which includes Chairman Bill Gates, Steve Ballmer, Bob Herbold, Pete Higgins, Paul Maritz, Nathan Myhrvold and Jeff Raikes.

"Microsoft's success is a result of great product development leadership as exemplified by Jim and Brad," Gates said in a statement. "Their active participation on the executive committee will be critical to our future."
Allchin and Silverberg will take on additional product responsibilities as well.
Allchin will head the personal and business systems group that includes the Windows division, server applications division and associated marketing functions.

Silverberg will run the applications and Internet client group including the desktop applications division, Internet client and collaboration division, tools division, Web authoring product unit, developer relations and associated marketing.
The new groups should boost product interoperability, while maintaining focus on individual products and target customers, Microsoft said.
Allchin and Silverberg will report to Group Vice President Paul Maritz, who retains responsibility for the consumer platforms division.
Redmond, Wash.-based Microsoft's stock rose $1.375 to $159.125 on Nasdaq at mid-morning.
